prompt: What is the name of the course?->
completion: Core Methods in Educational Data Mining.

prompt: Could you please provide the course number?->
How many credit hours is the course worth?->
Where will the course be conducted?->
completion: TBD or virtual via simulcast link (TBD).

prompt: What are the class times?->
Who is the instructor teaching the course?->
What are the contact details of the instructor?->
Where is the instructor's office located?->
What are the office hours for the instructor?->
Is there a teaching assistant for the course?->
completion: Yes, Rachel Liu and Tanvi Gupta.

prompt: Who are the TAs for this course?->
completion: Rachel Liu: xiner@upenn.edu / Tanvi Gupta: guptanvi@seas.upenn.edu.

prompt: What are the contact details of the TAs?->
completion: Rachel Liu: xiner@upenn.edu / Tanvi Gupta: guptanvi@seas.upenn.edu.

prompt: How can I contact the TAs?->
completion: You can attend the office hours or email them - Rachel Liu: xiner@upenn.edu / Tanvi Gupta: guptanvi@seas.upenn.edu.

prompt: Where is the TA's office located?->
When are the office hours for the TA?->
What are the specific course objectives?->
completion: To cover core methods in educational data mining, teach execution in standard software, understand limitations, and know when and why to use these methods.

prompt: What are the overall expectations from students?->
completion: Watch asynchronous videos, engage with content, complete assignments, and provide feedback on peers' work.

prompt: Where are the course readings?->
completion: Most readings are on the course schedule webpage (https://www.upenn.edu/learninganalytics/ryanbaker/EDM2023/index.html); other readings may be provided in class.

prompt: What additional materials does this course use?->
completion: Most readings are on the course schedule webpage (https://www.upenn.edu/learninganalytics/ryanbaker/EDM2023/index.html); other readings may be provided in class.

prompt: What is the course website?->
What is the course discussion forum?->
Is there a required text? If so, what is it?->
completion: Yes, "Big Data and Education, 7th edition" by R.S. Baker. Available at: https://www.upenn.edu/learninganalytics/MOOT/bigdataeducation.html.

prompt: What textbook is being used in this course?->
completion: "Big Data and Education, 7th edition" by R.S. Baker. Available at: https://www.upenn.edu/learninganalytics/MOOT/bigdataeducation.html.

prompt: Important dates (due dates, assignments, etc.)?->
completion: For detailed information about the assignments, please visit the course webpage https://www.upenn.edu/learninganalytics/ryanbaker/EDM2023/index.html.

prompt: What is the course prerequisite?->
completion: Python, EDUC7667, or instructor permission. Proficiency in Python is essential.

prompt: What is a basic assignment?->
completion: Practice questions on Assistment platform. For any setup inquiries, please contact the TAs.

prompt: When will I find the basic assignments?->
completion: Basic assignments are on the ASSISTments platform. You can use Google Classroom or ASSISTments directly.

prompt: What are basic assignments like?->
completion: Basic assignments involve data mining with instant feedback and context-sensitive hints.

prompt: What happens if I make a mistake in the basic assignment?->
completion: Making errors in the basic assignment has no penalties, regardless of what the system says.

prompt: What happens if I use hints in the basic assignment?->
completion: Requesting hints in the basic assignment incurs no penalties, unless you game the system.

prompt: How many hints can I use in the basic assignment?->
completion: You can use all the hints without penalties, unless you game the system.

prompt: How will you know if I game the system?->
completion: The system has a built-in detector to automatically detect instances of gaming the system.

prompt: Can I get credit if I used all the hints for a question?->
completion: Yes, there are no penalties for requesting hints, regardless of what the system says, unless you game the system.

prompt: Where can I view my grade after completing assignments?->
completion: If you complete the assignment in time, you will receive full credit.

prompt: What should I do after finishing each creative assignment?->
completion: After submitting your own creative assignment, post meaningfully on four other students’ creative assignments. Either section is fine.

prompt: What are the expectations for each creative assignment?->
completion: Creative assignments focus on personal discovery and learning from text and video resources, not flawless execution.

prompt: What does it mean to post on other students' assignments?->
completion: After submitting your own creative assignment, post meaningfully on four other students’ creative assignments. Either section is fine.

prompt: Why do I need to post on other students' assignments?->
completion: Posting on others' assignments allows you to explore alternative problem-solving approaches and benefits both you and your classmates.

prompt: How many students' assignments do I need to post on?->
completion: You need to post meaningfully on four other students’ creative assignments.

prompt: Can I discuss my approach with a friend for the assignment?->
completion: Yes! You can discuss different approaches, but not share step-by-step solutions.

prompt: Can I do the assignment with a classmate but write separately?->
completion: No, assignments are individual, but discussing readings or technical details on the forum is allowed.

prompt: Can I discuss readings or technical details on the forum?->
completion: Yes! You can discuss readings and technical details with your classmates as long as you don't share step-by-step solutions.

prompt: Can I ask my friend a UI question about ASSISTments?->
What can I discuss with my classmates?->
completion: You can discuss anything except sharing step-by-step solutions to assignments.

prompt: Can I do homework with friends together?->
completion: No, assignments are individual, but discussing readings or technical details on the forum is allowed.

prompt: What is the collaboration policy in class?->
completion: All assignments are individual. You must submit your own work, but discussing readings or technical details on the forum is allowed.

prompt: Can I get inspiration from my classmates' assignment posts?->
completion: Not recommended, but it's not considered an ethical violation.

prompt: Can I copy my classmates' code for any assignment?->
Can I copy my classmates' modified dataset for any assignment?->
Can we work in groups for the assignments?->
completion: No, all assignments are individual, but discussing readings or technical details on the forum is allowed.

prompt: How can I get in touch with Ryan?->
completion: You can post to the forum, come to office hours, or set up a virtual meeting with penn.learninganalytics@gmail.com or rybaker@upenn.edu.

prompt: Will you accommodate students?->
completion: Ryan tries to accommodate every student. You can talk to him during office hours or email the professor or TAs to set up a meeting.

prompt: I am worried about my coding skills, what should I do?->
completion: Come talk to us during office hours or email the professor or TAs to set up a meeting. Ryan tries to find a way to accommodate every student.

prompt: I have limited programming background in computer science, what should I do?->
completion: Come talk to us during office hours or email the professor or TAs to set up a meeting. Ryan tries to find a way to accommodate every student.

prompt: What should I do if I have a technical question or a question of general interest for the class?->
completion: You are highly recommended to post it on the discussion forum.

prompt: What happens if I submit my assignment after the deadline?->
completion: Please contact the professor and explain why your assignment is/will be late.

prompt: What is the policy for late assignments?->
completion: The professor intends to be more flexible than usual on extensions, but please contact the professor and explain why your assignment is/will be late.

prompt: What is a creative assignment?->
completion: In creative assignments, you will be given a prompt and expected to use all the knowledge learned from basic assignments to complete the project independently.

prompt: How many assignments are required?->
completion: Six basic assignments and three creative assignments. .

prompt: How many basic assignments are required?->
completion: Please choose 6 of them to complete: 3 from the first 4 (e.g. Basic Homework 1-4) and 3 from the second 4 (e.g. Basic Homework 5-8).

prompt: Where do I submit the assignments.?->
completion: Please submit all assignments on the discussion forum: http://educ.jeepytee.net/.

prompt: How many creative assignments are required?->
completion: Complete three out of four assigned creative homework.

prompt: What happens if I do more basic assignments?->
completion: Extra assignments will receive feedback but not be graded or replace higher graded ones.

prompt: What happens if I do more creative assignments?->
completion: Extra assignments will receive feedback but not be graded or replace higher graded ones.

prompt: What is the attendance policy for the course?->
completion: Attendance is not mandatory, but active participation is encouraged for a better learning experience.

prompt: What is the expected classroom behavior?->
completion: Participate actively by asking questions and contributing comments during in-person classes.

prompt: What is required asynchronous activities?->
completion: Complete creative assignments and provide substantive comments on at least four other students' submissions within five days to count towards your grade.

prompt: What are the grading criteria?->
completion: 6 of 8 Basic Assignments (up to 36%), 3 of 4 Creative Assignments (up to 39%), Asynchronous participation (up to 24%), and 1 bonus point.

prompt: When is the midterm?->
completion: No, there are no exams in this course.

prompt: When is the final exam?->
completion: No, there are no exams in this course.

prompt: Is there a tentative exam schedule?->
completion: No, there are no exams in this course.

prompt: What is the bonus for creative assignments?->
completion: The best hand-in for each creative assignment receives a special bonus of 20%.

prompt: Are other materials required for the course?->
completion: No, most readings are available on the course schedule webpage or will be provided in class.

prompt: Can AI be used for homework assistance?->
completion: Yes, you can use any of the foundation models, but please acknowledge their use in your hand-ins.

prompt: Can I get an extension for the assignments?->
completion: Contact the professor for extensions, but please be reasonable.

prompt: What is the course mask policy?->
completion: Please wear a mask during class if possible.

prompt: What is the policy on academic dishonesty?->
completion: Plagiarism or improper citation is not tolerated and follows the university's policy on academic dishonesty.

prompt: Is there a disability accommodation statement?->
completion: Please email Ryan to set up a meeting so we can best accommodate you.

prompt: Is there a makeup policy for missed exams or assignments?->
completion: Extensions will be given as needed within reasonable circumstances.

prompt: Are there any opportunities of earning extra credit?->
completion: The best hand-in for each creative assignment receives a special bonus of 20%. There are no other extra credit opportunities.

prompt: Is there a group project?->
completion: No, there is no group project in this course.

prompt: When are assignments made available?->
completion: Assignments for the course are accessible from the start and can be accessed through the course webpage: https://www.upenn.edu/learninganalytics/ryanbaker/EDM2023/index.html.

prompt: Do we have a class on labor day?->
completion: No, there's no class on Labor Day on September 4, 2023. Please refer to the academic calendar - https://almanac.upenn.edu/penn-academic-calendar.

prompt: What is the deadline to drop this course?->
completion: Drop period for courses ends on October 9. Please refer to the academic calendar - https://almanac.upenn.edu/penn-academic-calendar.

prompt: When is the fall break?->
completion: The fall break is from October 12-15. Please refer to the academic calendar - https://almanac.upenn.edu/penn-academic-calendar.

completion: This is not a statistics class but EDM methods will be compared to statistics throughout the class.

completion: You can attend either of the two sections, it is up to you.

completion: Ryan will post a poll to schedule this on the discussion forum.

prompt: What should I do if I have questions?->
completion: You could post to the discussion forum, come to the offcie hours, or contact us.

prompt: What is Jeepytee?->
completion: Jeepytee is a LLM-powered TA. It is not just basic GPT-4; we have done some pre-training.

prompt: What can Jeepytee do? ?->
completion: Jeepytee will answer some of your questions when Ryan and the TAs aren’t available.

prompt: Will there be any research involving Jeepytee?->
completion: Yes! Ryan and colleagues will be conducting a study on Jeepytee, which they will invite you to join.
